WorkItem.Description:
From what I've been able to gather, engineering tinkers now stack with regular enchants.  The tinkers that matter all seem to be On Use:
http://cata.wowhead.com/spell=82177 (Gloves)  1500 Armour 12s / 1min
http://cata.wowhead.com/spell=82175 (Gloves)  480 Int 12s / 1min
http://cata.wowhead.com/spell=82180 (Gloves)  4320 to 5280 Nature damage / 2min
http://cata.wowhead.com/spell=84427 (Belt)      16200 to 19800 absorb shield ?sec / 5min
Â 
The passive bonus's have been removed from existing tinkers (e.g. 24 crit from Nitro Boosts is gone).

Comments.Message: I don't have an engineer so can't test this, can anyone confirm in the Live Release of WoW that the Tinker enchants stack with Enchanting Enchants?
I can confirm that the tinkers to the belt stack with the extra socket (i.e. Nitro Boosts, the absord shield).  However, haven't been able to check the glove tinkers yet.

Well, the tinkers are in the system, for the most part (including the belt socket ones). I purposely skipped a few since RAWR has no way of modeling them:

Cardboard Assassin: http://www.wowhead.com/spell=84425
Invisibility Field: http://www.wowhead.com/spell=84424
Spinal Healing Injector: http://www.wowhead.com/spell=82200
Z50 Mana Gulper: http://www.wowhead.com/spell=82201
(The last two I was not sure if it followed the potion rules so I did not do anything to them)

Just I didn't realize that they were in addition to the normal enchants.

http://us.battle.net/wow/en/character/feathermoon/lupiko/advanced

I can confirm that the glove tinkers stack with enchants: +20 (Greater) Agility and Hyperspeed Accelerators are both on my current gloves. The Flexweave Underlay also stacks with cloak enchants, but that's not as useful to know since it adds no dps/tanking-related stats, only an environmental effect (slow fall) that can't really be simulated.
I have a shelveset in place for Kavan to work on/complete. After he's done we will have full support for this.

My moonkin is an engineer and he has a regular & engineering enchant on gloves. On import Rawr shows only the regular enchant and not the engineering one. It may also be that Rawr.Addon needs to add support for Engineering tinkers too, if so we may need to adjust the format of the item string.

Yes, we will need to update the AddOn, but Kavan needs to take some time with the shelveset I mentioned previously first. Once he has that settled we will know what format to put the parsing on the Battle.Net and AddOn Import processes.
Ok, thanks to Kavan's wonderful work the shelveset has been implemented. The only problem left is trying to select another tinkering doesn't actually work >.<
